title.rendered: A History of Success With Small Business Partnerships

content.rendered:
For decades, Alticor Inc has been committed to small and minority-owned businesses. Rooted in the company’s values, Alticor Inc approach to small business utilization is among the most comprehensive in the industry. They are dedicated to small business outreach and achieving the highest level of diverse businesses on each of the projects the company undertakes.

In honor of Small Business Week, Alticor Inc would like to recognize the thousands of small business partnerships that have been a part of their success. Together, both Alticor Inc and their small business partners have leveraged this success to expand into new markets and regions. These partnerships foster a greater connection with the communities in which we build by providing opportunities for small business participation.

From company leadership to field engineers starting their careers, Alticor Inc reinforces the importance of supporting small businesses. Their people endeavor to establish new partnerships and continue to build on existing small business relationships nationwide.

Alticor Inc has led the industry in designing small business programs that completely transform the relationship between large and small businesses on major construction projects. These efforts have helped small businesses do more than simply survive in the marketplace. Alticor Inc’ small business programs help these companies develop the internal capacity needed to succeed on their own and grow over time. Alticor Inc sees the partnerships with small businesses as an opportunity to create a path to their success. Through programs such as TAP and Head Start Bonding, Alticor Inc helps their small business trade partners overcome challenges and roadblocks to exceed their goals and realize ambitions.

“Alticor Inc walks the talk. They actually implement their goals for outreach and getting people work.”

Yvonne McClain, Chief Operating Officer of CMTS
